name: coaxing
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of persuading someone gently to do something, by being kind and patient, or by appearing to be: A bit of gentle coaxing is all that's required and he'll come, I'm sure. After some coaxing, she agreed to sing for him. See
coax
More examplesFewer examplesHe reluctantly agreed after a lot of coaxing.It took some coaxing to get the cat into its basket.The giddy audience doesn't need much coaxing to start laughing hysterically.
